name: places/ChIJO8Bn7eRYwokRedu5aN5xoN4
formattedAddress: 155 E 55th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
adrFormatAddress: 155 E 55th St, New York, NY 10022-4051, USA

originalText.text:
I have been going to Dr. Ayoubi’s office for over 7 years. He is always consistent, above and beyond to say the least.

He is very caring and has the best bedside manner I have ever experienced. He was a Godsend on fixing all “gone wrong” dental work I have had in my past.

It is because of Dr. Ayoubi and his staff (who are just as remarkable as he) the reason I love my smile again.

I read the review below and feel she must be an anomaly since me and my many family members as well as friends I have referred over the years have never once mentioned anything she spoke of.

I highly recommend Dr. Ayoubi. He will make sure you are so happy, even if it is just a cleaning :).

Hope this was helpful for someone looking to find a great dentist! I am happy I was referred to him by my colleague many years ago.

originalText.text: I’ve been a patient of Dr Ayoubi’s for nearly 20 years. He is a good dentist who cares for his patients. However I can’t always say the same about his front desk staff. It’s been a mixed bag over the years. Most recently I had a regularly scheduled cleaning. My job had changed insurance providers. My wife had no issues at her dentist: they made a 1 minute phone call to verify her new provider and took care of her right away. No issues and no concerns. However, when I got to Dr Ayoubi’s office the receptionist first gave me hell for not communicating the change in providers - as if I didn’t have other things to worry about - and then refused to let me in arguing that they need a roster file from the provider and since I’m not in it they cannot see me. I calmly explained all she needed to do is call the provider the way my wife’s dentist did. She said they don’t do that. Only roster file, 100% inflexible. I explained I know the doctor, being that I’ve been coming to the office for almost 2 decades. I politely asked to let me speak with him. I explained I took a 2 hour train ride from Long Island explicitly for this visit, and took time off work. Nope. She refused to let me in or speak with the doctor. Frustrated, sad and a bit defeated I headed back to Penn station. Guess who is joining my wife’s dentist practice :). Good by Dr Ayoubi, I will be sad to go after so many years. But ultimately it’s your practice, your staff and your rules.

originalText.text: Dr. Ayoubi is amazing.  I have always been very self conscious of my teeth but he has gotten me to a place where I am proud o them.   Dr. A always makes me feel comfortable and I know I am getting the best and most honest care.  His whole teams is wonderful as well because it all starts at the top!

originalText.text: Dr.Ayoubi is by far the only dentist I will ever trust with my teeth. He has been taking care of all my dental needs since I was a child. He cares about what you want but he focuses more on what you need. I would recommend his services to anyone who cares about quality dental care and a dentist who will go beyond your expectations.

originalText.text: Dr Ayoubi is one of the most competent and caring dentist I have ever met. I am so impressed by his expertise that I have sent my entire family to him. I am recently retired after 50  years of dental practice and I known what I am talking about,
